main event: A bright object was observed over the Mississippi River on 11th November 1952 at 11:45 PM CST. Another observation was made on 18th July 1952 in Rock Island, Illinois, where a brilliant object was seen rising and then possibly connected to the approach of a twin engines aircraft with one landing light on.
interesting points: The first observation occurred at a height of 5 to 10 miles above the ground.
The object observed in Rock Island rose to 22 degrees in 2 seconds.
The witness was a civilian man and a member of the local astronomy club.
The witness reported clear weather conditions with visibility of more than 15 miles.
The report was filed to the Quad City Airport, Moline, Illinois, and the Wright Patterson Air Force Base in Ohio.
location: Mississippi River and Rock Island, Illinois
witnesses: civilian man and member of the local astronomy club
